alert.note: Alert for Phillips County; Sedgwick County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 24 at 12:40PM MST until December 27 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...POSSIBLE BLIZZARD CONDITIONS FOR THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF COLORADO LATE MONDAY THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY... .Very strong winds are expected late Monday into Wednesday morning. The more uncertain part of the forecast are the snow amounts. There will be a very narrow east to west gradient in snowfall, but if the heaviest band of snow reaches Phillips and Sedgwick Counties, blizzard conditions are possible greatly impacting travel much of the day on Tuesday. Travelers planning to travel east on I-76 late Monday through Tuesday should closely monitor the forecast. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 4 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Julesburg, and Holyoke. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Plan on slippery road conditions and very difficult travel conditions.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Persons should consider delaying travel on Tuesday. Motorists should use extreme caution if travel is absolutely necessary.
